result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Jay Lawrence

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher Jay Lawrence appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Awni M Yasin appeared by video for Christopher Jay Lawrence.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea and sentencing hearing held. Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case 22CM1774 for the purpose of sentencing.

Defendant Christopher Jay Lawrence not in court, in custody.  Attorney Awni M Yasin appeared by video for Christopher Jay Lawrence.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing. Court has availability today to complete a plea and sentencing hearing. Court passes case to 2:30 pm to complete a plea and sentencing hearing.
Signed and filed, No Contact/No Firearms Order.  Defendant to have no contact with D.S.J.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION. As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit. Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.

Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Awni Yasin, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense.

Defendant Christopher Jay Lawrence in court.  Attorney Awni M Yasin in court for Christopher Jay Lawrence.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Christopher Jay Lawrence appeared by video.  Attorney Awni M Yasin in court for Christopher Jay Lawrence.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for an initial appearance. Defendant appears via video only. Court adjourns the matter for defendant to appear in person. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Initial appearance scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
